FuncDef:
The crypto password irreversible-algorithm hmac-sha256 command sets the ciphertext password encryption algorithm to HMAC-SHA256.
The undo crypto password irreversible-algorithm hmac-sha256 command restores the ciphertext password encryption algorithm to scrypt.
The default ciphertext password encryption algorithm is scrypt.
Examples: Warning: Setting algorithm to hmac-sha256 will result in the encrypt-algorithm being insecure. Continue? [Y/N]:y
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To set the ciphertext password encryption algorithm to HMAC-SHA256, run the crypto password irreversible-algorithm hmac-sha256 command.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
